jobs.title: Proposal/Bid Manager
jobs.description:
Making Mobility Seamless

Vix is a global leader in automated fare collection, transit information and transit analytics solutions. Trusted by over 200 city and regional transport authorities around the world, we have been driving change in fare collection for over 35 years.

We offer a genuinely flexible working environment – customer outcomes and commitment to delivery is the focus at Vix. Work from the office, work from home, work from the local café – you’ll be able to manage your personal and professional commitments seamlessly at Vix. In fact, HRD gave Vix the excellence award in 2021 for our MyFlex program.

Find out more about your new workplace here!

We're on the hunt for a creative Bid/Proposal Writer, with a talent for writing compelling, customer focused proposals to enable Vix to win new business. This role that will suit someone that loves a variety of responsibilities and working across multiple teams, collaborating with colleagues globally. You can take advantage of both remote working and our newly appointed professional suites located in Tempe, AZ.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Managing the bid qualification process, bid development, and bid submission in conjunction with all key stakeholders.
  • Ensuring adequate rigor, governance and quality of response across the entire bid process.
  • Maintain Vix Americas staff professional biographies and head shots for all Vix Americas staff and global Vix staff who routinely perform work on Vix Americas projects. Create a database of bio/CV content to easily add to bids.
  • Manage bid stakeholders and overcome obstacles as they arise throughout the evaluation and approval processes.
  • Ensure that third party support contracts and commercial frameworks are executed in conjunction with commercial lead as required.
  • Use Salesforce to capture status updates and progress, to enable better reporting and to ensure one true source of information
  • Ensure alignment with global process and reporting (including contributing to definition of both)

Pre-Bid Activities

  • Register with prospective agencies’ procurement portals to ensure timely receipt of relevant solicitation documents
  • Tracking of upcoming requests for proposal (RFP) and requests for information (RFI), overall bid resource forecasting, and helping to prioritize prospective opportunities.
  • Support the development and cataloguing of standard bid solution narratives and related visuals, and the creation of custom content as required. Maintain all bid content in the Vix global bid library.
  • Support subcontractor and partner teaming agreements, and the shaping of customer requirements in advance of proposal submission.
  • Assess the resource requirements for pre-qualification and tender activity and to monitor progress of tenders.

Bid Activities

  • Create and manage the Vix bid team for active opportunities and manage the approval process in conjunction with the North American Strategic Sales team.
  • Drive a culture of continuous improvement in bid responses
  • Create and maintain the project folder structure for each opportunity on Vix’s internal shares to ensure efficient document management and effective team collaboration.
  • Maintain all pre-bid documents, meeting notes and related bid documentation.
  • Schedule and lead a bid team kick-off meeting and all subsequent bid team progress meetings.
  • Manage all bids using a standard bid plan template that includes a schedule, key deliverables, action items, proposal outline, responsibility matrix (RACI diagram), and risk registry.
  • Help define win themes and ensure these are effectively incorporated into the response.
  • Manage bid review, decision and submission timelines.
  • Define all bid workstreams and assign primary and secondary owners to each stream.
  • Lead bid reviews to ensure a timely, complete and compelling response. Understand and apply bid management best practices
  • Create and distribute a weekly bid progress memo appropriate to the size of the bid.
  • Identify and secure the resources who will review narratives and pricing, as well as a team to mock score each section against the solicitation evaluation criteria.
  • Manage the bid approval process and ensure timely approvals of internal stakeholders and external teammates are obtained.
  • Coordinate and get approval for pricing and margins.

Bid Delivery

  • Ensure timely and compliant delivery of all bids.

Post Bid Activities

  • Add any new bid content created to the bid library and maintain the bid library on an ongoing basis.
  • Work with the opportunity owner through contract negotiations and achieve a successful handover to delivery team for winning bids and proposals.
  • Maintain archives and control access to bid directories to ensure the information is available for future reference and restricted to personnel who have an on-going need to access the information.
  • Lead bid debriefs identifying what went well, what didn’t go well, root causes of any issues, and recommendations for improvement.
  • Should Vix not be selected in a bid, participate in a debrief with the customer to fully identify the customer’s selection rationale and key lessons for future Vix bids.
  • Plan and organise the necessary resources to participate in any post submission activities such as clarifications rounds, BAFO, and negotiations.
  • Obtain proof of delivery.

Requirements

Skills & Qualifications

    Required

  • Advanced project management skills, including sound judgement to manage competing priorities, work under pressure, and deliver to tight timeframes.
  • Experience working on complex bids with associated operational processes, and project management methodologies.
  • Exceptional attention to detail, with proven ability to manage internal and external stakeholders responsible for content.
  • Excellent communication skills including the ability to produce clear, concise and persuasive written material and presentations to move the team toward a common vision or goal.
  • High emotional intelligence and interpersonal skills; an ability to work with and get the best out of many different types of personalities at different levels of seniority; adaptable, flexible and comfortable with change.
  • Consummate team player with a burning desire to contribute; finds enjoyment in team success; gives and shares credit for success; a fundamentally positive outlook and disposition.
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher.
  • Strong time management and ability to plan and meet deadlines for internal and external stakeholders.


    • Desired

  • Proven self-starter who can hit the ground running with limited direction.
  • Fast and agile learner; desire to learn, improve and avoid repeating mistakes; strong appetite for feedback.
  • Commercial orientation with an ability to think practically about risk and reward in relation to commercial positions and methodology and successfully advocate these positions through the business


Knowledge & Experience

Required

  • 5 or more years of multi-million dollar bid management experience, including business case preparation and senior executive review.
  • Experience driving cross-functional virtual teams or directly managing complex teams.
  • Experience working in a fast moving, complex, environment.
  • Experience managing diverse stakeholders to meet milestones in a project schedule.
  • Demonstrated ability to balance complex commercial, operational, legal and regulatory perspectives.


Desired

  • Transit or public agency industry knowledge.
  • Experience in bidding large SaaS enterprise opportunities.
  • Payments background or understanding
  • Experience managing third party suppliers in a large system delivery.
  • Experience working for a global company and demonstrated success managing and working with resources in disparate time zones.
  • Experience working with a systems integrator.
  • Experience with software license and API access agreements.
  • APMP or similar certification.
  • Basic knowledge of local procurement rules and forthcoming legislative changes.


What’s in it for you?

Besides the opportunity to work for a global company that is customer and people focused, we offer:

  • An award-winning flexible working culture with a truly flexible working environment –– we don’t get hung up on location, we are interested in achieving outcomes for and delivering to our customers.
  • A focus on learning and development – we have a sleek onboarding and L&D platform – get up to speed quickly and continue learning on your Vix journey
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Training & Development
  • Work From Home
  • 401(k) matching

Sounds good? Then apply now. Get on board here!

Add your resume and anything else to showcase why you would be a great addition to our team. Unless otherwise stated, we regret that this position is only available to people with unrestricted working rights for the United States, and currently residing in the United States.

No recruitment agencies, please! We won’t accept any introductions.

Vix Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all people and want to build a workforce as diverse as the community we serve. We aim to have a work environment where everyone feels included and everyone can realise their full potential.

HumanCentric was founded in 2015 and is a profitable, high-growth, eCommerce brand. The ideal candidate will have a passion for writing and a strong understanding of the e-commerce landscape.

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager
jobs.description:
What is ReturnBear?

Retail returns suck. We all hate packing, printing, and shipping unwanted items only to wait weeks for a refund. Retailers have it rough too. They have to figure out what has to be re-sold, refurbished, or recycled, and if they don't figure it out fast enough, they might as well send everything to a landfill. Nobody wins.

This is why ReturnBear exists. We are Canada's first end-to-end reverse logistics solution. Our nationwide drop-off network means immediate exchanges and returns with no re-packing. We sort and QA goods to get inventory back to merchants fast, giving retailers 20%+ savings and making consumers happier. We make returns easy for everyone and better for the planet.

Why Join Us?

  1. Redefine reverse logistics. We are pioneering how reverse logistics should be done and are backed by large players like Cadillac Fairview and the Ontario Teacher's Pension Plan. Join us to set the standard.
  2. Reduce carbon. As much as 30% of retail goods sold are returned. And when retailers can't figure out how to make the process efficient, it becomes easier to just chuck items into landfill, create waste, and unnecessarily shipping goods across the country, adding to more emissions. By joining ReturnBear, you are not only solving a clear pain point, you're also helping the environment.
  3. Wildly improve customer experiences. Returns and exchanges can be better. They can be simple. They can be fast. They can be cost-effective. Help us design a new solution standard where customers can enjoy the peace of mind of knowing that their returns and exchanges can be handled instantly, while merchants get products back ready to resell faster than ever before.

The Role

We're looking for a Senior Product Manager to help define and execute the roadmap for ReturnBear's suite of reverse-logistics products and solutions. In this role, you'll:

  • Collect quantitative and qualitative feedback from our customers, sales, and internal team members in order to define the right problems to solve
  • Contribute to defining product priorities based on ReturnBear's strategy, user and market research, and data 
  • Build experiences for our Merchants, Consumers, Partners and our internal Operations team that makes returns simpler and better for everyone
  • Define requirements and collaborate with Engineering, Design and Partners to translate complex user problems into simple, user-friendly solutions 
  • Together with the Head of Product, define/prioritize problems and set outcomes/goals for the team, and ensure key product metrics are achieved against ReturnBear's objectives 
  • Lead by getting products and features shipped including customer-facing release communications, internal UAT testing, customer pilots, onboarding flows, and internal enablement
  • Be a thought leader and share ideas through publications, case studies or any related product marketing initiatives to position the product value to the market

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of relevant experience in software product management, ideally in B2B SaaS, Retail/CPG Tech or Logistics Technology working as a part of an agile product methodology alongside engineering and design teams
  • You thrive in ambiguous, fast-paced environments, and can easily context-switch between writing merchant-facing user stories, interviewing customers, jumping on a partnership call, and whiteboarding user flows for a new consumer experience 
  • You like to keep a pulse on technology, industry, market and competitive landscape to inform your product prioritization
  • You're comfortable operating in a technical environment, making informed data decisions or sometimes lack thereof
  • You understand the levers you have at your disposal to protect the project and deadlines
  • You are willing and able to travel across North America on a regular basis
  • Bonus if you have knowledge of Canadian retail, e-commerce, reverse logistics, supply chain, and related technology solutions

What we look for

  • Ownership mentality. “It's their problem, not mine” doesn't have a place here. You own the problems and challenges that you see, and proactively work with your colleagues to turn them into opportunities. We're in it together!
  • Growth mindset. You learn from your mistakes and believe in human potential. It's not that you can't overcome the challenge you're facing, it's just that you haven't overcome it yet. You appreciate the diverse thoughts and perspectives of your colleagues, partners and clients, and you are committed to actively listening and learning. 
  • Getting things done. You are keen to do great work, and ship things often. “Done is better than perfect” might be something you believe in, and while you always strive to deliver what is best for you and your team, you realize that sometimes you'll have to circle back on it to iterate and make improvements. 
  • Flexibility and comfort in ambiguity. You embrace the agile nature of design and development, and you are equally comfortable pivoting your plan and process as you are establishing a workback schedule. Try as we might, things won't always go as planned, and you always try to be ready to deal with that as it comes. 
  • Passion for the problems we're solving. You understand how ecommerce and retail ecosystems are growing with emerging brands and solution providers, and you're keen to make an impact not just on the lives of customers, but on the businesses of our merchant partners and on the environment as well. Together we can save merchants and their customers time and money, AND we can help keep returns out of landfills. 

Our Commitments

  • Diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates regardless of their background, sexuality, physical abilities and ways of self-identification.
  • Honing your craft, your way. We provide the opportunities to develop your skills and knowledge. We work collaboratively and flexibly, with opportunities to shape a hybrid working style suited to your needs.

We hope you're as excited by ReturnBear as we are, and look forward to chatting!

A·Team is a VC-backed, stealth, application-only home on the internet for senior independent software builders to team up with hand-picked, high-growth companies on their next big thing. 

After talking with hundreds of independent engineers, designers, and product folks, we heard over and over that finding vetted, high-quality, consistent clients is hard, and projects are often too small to be rewarding. A·Team matches small teams of the most talented builders in the world with companies backed by a16z, YC, Softbank, General Catalyst, etc. on a contract basis for many of their most important initiatives. We quietly launched in May 2020, and have helped A·Teamers earn $11.4+ million since.

As part of A·Team, you can expect:

  • High-paying, meaningful missions with the most audacious companies sent your way; generally $110-$190/hr, with vetted, fascinating clients doing work that matters. We're picky about who we partner with; new clients only come in via trusted referral. We've worked with Lyft, McGraw Hill, ClearCo, irl.com, the former CEO of Waze, the leading vaccine production software, several new unicorns we can't say here, and dozens of startups backed by a16z/YC/Softbank/etc.
  • Work alongside friends old & new: our niche is small/diverse product teams, since clients with larger budgets and higher-impact work tell us they want teams, not individuals. Of course, we keep friends together whenever we can.
  • Full autonomy: say "no" to things that don't excite you. The most talented builders often juggle a few things at once, so there's never pressure to join an A·Team mission if you don't have the bandwidth. If we're no longer a fit, it's easy to leave or pause too. 
  • Small, curated, off-the-record gatherings: for conversations hard to have elsewhere. Long-term, we're creating micro-communities for the world's top builders to become friends around the things they care about.
  • Keep 100% of what you earn: if you charge $130/hr, you get $130/hr. A·Team makes money by charging a small, flat, transparent platform fee on top of your rate.

 

 

How to apply:

Go here: https://build.a.team/remotivereferral + mention Remotive. No resume or cover letter needed; we respect your time so the application is short. We're also much more interested in seeing what you've made, and excited to chat more if there’s a fit.

What you’ll do:

  • Once part of A.Team, you’ll regularly be invited to impactful missions that match your interests, which you can accept or decline. Take your pick from early-stage incubations with world-class founders, to fast-growing super-funded companies, to old school non-tech incumbents looking to build as a tech giant would

  • Missions usually involve building an ambitious piece of software from 0 to 1 as part of a small 3-4 person team. 

  • You’ll be paid to scope it out, give the client options, guide strategy, and execute on the selected solution. Sometimes the client has a clear vision, sometimes not; which is why A.Team builders tend to be senior folks who can work together to find the right direction. 

Who A·Team is for:

  • Senior software developers who left large companies and high-growth startups to pursue their craft with autonomy.

  • Those who prefer consistent contract work over a full-time role, who want to create a variety of new products alongside other top-tier builders.

  • The majority of A.Teamers spend most of their time doing independent work, but a sizeable percentage are either employed full-time (but testing out client work), bootstrapping a side project, or looking for their next big thing

Who A·Team is not for:

  • People looking for small gigs

  • Folks looking to build simple wordpress/wix/squarespace-style websites

  • Those still early in their careers and recent university/bootcamp grads (at least not yet)

Our long-term vision:

A·Team is a new type of company for a new kind of independent software builder. We call them "unhirables": people who traditional companies couldn’t hire full-time even if they wanted to, but who want to do their most meaningful work with their favorite people in small, autonomous, distributed expert teams. 

To help us secure amazing missions, we raised $5 million+ (not public, yet) from NFX, Village Global, and Box Group, along with the former CEO of Upwork, the founders of Fiverr and Lemonade, Apple's Global Head of Recruiting, YC Partner Aaron Harris, Wharton's Adam Grant, and Duke's Dan Ariely.

We're looking for a backend developer to join our cross-functional engagement team. You'll build the business logic and protocols that deliver flexible flows across devices, scale highly distributed systems, and continuously improve our infrastructure to become the largest global tech school and help millions more to learn to code.

 

What you’ll be doing

  • You’ll design, build, and ship major user-facing engagement features in collaboration with product managers, designers, and developers, using C# and ASP.NET Core with some TypeScript sprinkled on top for some microservices.
  • You’ll develop backend components in conjunction with SQL Server, the underlying database on top of Entity Framework Core as ORM.

You’ll thrive in this role if

  • You’re a seasoned developer. You have multiple years of experience as a developer shipping features for large-scale and real-time applications using C# and ASP.NET Core, building consumer-facing products, and actively helping others to improve.
  • You’ve built and maintained APIs. You hold yourself and others to a high bar when working with production systems, bringing a sound understanding of API design and best practices.
  • You care about code quality. You follow engineering best practices like code reviews to ensure and maintain excellent application performance and code quality.
  • You take the lead to ensure reliability. Practical experience securing, monitoring, log analysis and conducting investigations in cloud-based environments (we use GCP).
  • You bring excellent attention to detail. You’ll put the user first when reasoning trade-offs while caring deeply about close attention to detail.
  • You ooze the values of the DevOps mindset. You’re intensely curious and passionate about running software in DevOps environments and eager to explore more about DevOps and SRE.
  • You know a thing or two about architecture, containerization, and orchestration. You’re keen to learn/or use container systems like Docker and/or Platform as a Service.
  • You have a sense of ownership. You believe in solving a problem entirely rather than simply shipping a solution. You operate autonomously and follow through on your commitments.

 

How we work

  • We’re a distributed team working between the time zones of Eastern Standard Time (UTC -5) and Eastern European Time (UTC +2) for collaboration. For this role, we ask you to be located adjacent to Eastern European Time (UTC ±0 to UTC +2).
  • If you’re located outside this time zone range and want to move to the company’s official headquarters in Austria, we’ll handle the work permit process and cover travel expenses.
  • If you prefer to work outside your home, we offer a physical location in Vienna and co-working stipends in other cities.
  • We love working async so that you can set your own pace and schedule.

 

Our global perks and benefits

  • We have a remote-first mentality and give everyone a home-office budget.
  • 25 days of paid vacation in addition to your local public holidays and paid sick leave.
  • We sponsor team retreats throughout Europe and remote-friendly activities, like hack weeks and coffee breaks.
  • To further develop yourself, use our €1k growth budget for books, online courses, conferences, or anything else that supports your development.
  • To give our menstruating team members the time off to cater to their health when needed during their menstrual cycle, we offer up to 2 days of paid menstrual leave per month.
  • Your annual gross salary is €61k, which will automatically increase by 5% yearly. No questions asked.
  • The chance to build a world-class product, positively impact millions of aspiring developers, and be a virtual owner of the company with equity (phantom stock).

 

About us

With the Mimo app, we've made it easy and fun for more than 15 million beginners to start coding on the go and build up their confidence to pursue a career in tech. From bite-size coding exercises to full-fledged projects, we’re helping our learners form a habit of coding and reach university-level learning outcomes.
